recipe.name: Bacon French Toast Roll Ups
recipe.description: Crispy bacon rolled up in french toast that you can eat with your hands. Take it to an insane level by adding Nachos Cheese Dipping Sauce to dunk the roll ups in.
recipeIngredient: 6 slices fresh soft sandwich bread ((I used white, but you could use wholemeal, wholegrain etc) (note 1))
6 slices of streaky bacon (, rind removed (note 3))
2 tbsp milk ((full cream or low fat))

recipeInstructions.text: Use a rolling pin and roll back and forth 3 or 4 times on each piece of bread to flatten it out. Because it is fresh bread, it should become a bit sticky.
recipeInstructions.name: Use a rolling pin and roll back and forth 3 or 4 times on each piece of bread to flatten it out. Because it is fresh bread, it should become a bit sticky.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine egg, milk and salt in a dish or bowl that is large enough for a roll up to lie flat in (so you can roll it in the egg mixture). Whisk with a fork to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine egg, milk and salt in a dish or bowl that is large enough for a roll up to lie flat in (so you can roll it in the egg mixture). Whisk with a fork to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat large pan over high heat (no oil required because the bacon is so fatty).
recipeInstructions.name: Heat large pan over high heat (no oil required because the bacon is so fatty).

recipeInstructions.text: Place bacon in the pan and sear each side until browned but not until it is crispy. If it is too crispy, it will just crumble when rolled up.
recipeInstructions.name: Place bacon in the pan and sear each side until browned but not until it is crispy. If it is too crispy, it will just crumble when rolled up.

recipeInstructions.text: Place one piece of bacon in the middle of each piece of bread.
recipeInstructions.name: Place one piece of bacon in the middle of each piece of bread.

recipeInstructions.text: Roll up the bread, ending with the seam side down. Press down lightly to help it stay in place.
recipeInstructions.name: Roll up the bread, ending with the seam side down. Press down lightly to help it stay in place.

recipeInstructions.text: Wipe pan clean, place butter in pan and return pan to heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Wipe pan clean, place butter in pan and return pan to heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Roll a roll up in the egg mixture, then shake off excess. Enclose your fist around it (lightly) and twist the roll up a few times back and forth. This rubs the egg mixture into the roll up and helps ensure the seam remains sealed. Repeat with remaining roll ups.
recipeInstructions.name: Roll a roll up in the egg mixture, then shake off excess. Enclose your fist around it (lightly) and twist the roll up a few times back and forth. This rubs the egg mixture into the roll up and helps ensure the seam remains sealed. Repeat with remaining roll ups.

recipeInstructions.text: Place roll ups in the pan. Cook, rotating, for around 3 to 4 minutes until all sides are golden brown.
recipeInstructions.name: Place roll ups in the pan. Cook, rotating, for around 3 to 4 minutes until all sides are golden brown.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove and serve immediately, with warmed Nachos Cheese Dip (if using).
recipeInstructions.name: Remove and serve immediately, with warmed Nachos Cheese Dip (if using).

review.reviewBody: Hi Nagi, a quick question: you wrote that you loved using brioche for French toast but then you talk about stale bread. Do you leave the brioche to be stale? Thanks!
Another of your delicious recipes I try to do  a new one each week!
These are so delicious and surprisingly filling!
Made this for breakfast this morning.  So good!

Nagi, your blog is the only one I read from start to finish. Streaky bacon, sourdough cob, just a few of the terms you use that I find endearing. Us Yanks love Aussies!!! I have never met an Aussie that wasn't warm and friendly. I was looking for chicken recipes and found this one. Give Dozer a big hug from me. This is Thanksgiving week here and I am trying your Lemon Turkey this year so I will be thinking of you. Thanks for ALL your great recipes. Barb
Just a quik comment they sound wonderful and my grandma fed us pancakes with bacon and strawberry jam and they were fantastic !!!!  So these dipped in jam may be great !
These were very good! I will be doing again, but possibly not getting so anxious about rolling the bread TOTALLY flat. Thanks for sharing a good idea.
